entities.name: harry
entities.description: Harry is the main character of the story, who is being followed by Filch.

entities.name: nearly headless nick
entities.description: Nearly Headless Nick is a ghost who lives in the castle and is mentioned as someone Harry says goodbye to.

entities.name: filch
entities.description: Filch is a teacher at Hogwarts who is known for being strict and punitive, and is currently following Harry downstairs.

entities.name: fred weasley
entities.description: Fred Weasley is one of the twins who have an entire drawer dedicated to them in Filch's office.

entities.name: george weasley
entities.description: George Weasley is the other twin who has an entire drawer dedicated to him and his brother Fred in Filch's office.

entities.name: dumbledore
entities.description: Dumbledore is the headmaster of Hogwarts, who is mentioned as someone Filch often begs to let him suspend students by their ankles from the ceiling.

relationships.description: Harry is being followed by Filch downstairs, as mentioned in the text: 'and followed Filch back downstairs'.
Fred and George Weasley are brothers, as mentioned in the text: 'Fred and George Weasley had an entire drawer to themselves'.

Filch often begs Dumbledore to let him suspend students by their ankles from the ceiling, as mentioned in the text: 'It was common knowledge that he was always begging Dumbledore to let him suspend students by their ankles from the ceiling'.
